support.description: Content is actively maintained. Please report errors and inconsistencies

author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.en: “Mendicants, phoenixes reproduce in these four ways.
Phoenixes are born from eggs, from a womb, from moisture, or spontaneously.
These are the four ways that phoenixes reproduce.

segments.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, aṇḍajā supaṇṇā aṇḍajeva nāge haranti, na jalābuje, na saṃsedaje, na opapātike.
segments.en: Of these, phoenixes born from an egg can only carry off dragons born from an egg, not those born from a womb, from moisture, or spontaneously.

segments.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, jalābujā supaṇṇā aṇḍaje ca jalābuje ca nāge haranti, na saṃsedaje, na opapātike.
segments.en: Phoenixes born from a womb can carry off dragons born from an egg or from a womb, but not those born from moisture or spontaneously.

segments.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, saṃsedajā supaṇṇā aṇḍaje ca jalābuje ca saṃsedaje ca nāge haranti, na opapātike.
segments.en: Phoenixes born from moisture can carry off dragons born from an egg, from a womb, or from moisture, but not those born spontaneously.

segments.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, opapātikā supaṇṇā aṇḍaje ca jalābuje ca saṃsedaje ca opapātike ca nāge haranti.
segments.en: Phoenixes born spontaneously can carry off dragons born from an egg, from a womb, from moisture, or spontaneously.
These are the four ways that phoenixes reproduce.”

suttaplex.blurb: Phoenixes may be born from eggs, the womb, moisture, or spontaneously. Each of them may carry off a dragon of lower birth.
